alert.note: Alert for Kings; New York; Richmond (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 12:22AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast New York and northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, in northeast New Jersey, Hudson. In southeast New York, Kings (Brooklyn), New York (Manhattan) and Richmond (Staten Island). * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1222 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1/2 and 3/4 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Jersey City, Bayonne, Hoboken, Midtown Manhattan, Lower East Side, Union City, East Village, SoHo, Port Richmond, Brooklyn Heights, Battery Park, Tompkinsville, Upper West Side, North Bergen, West New York, Greenpoint, Weehawken, Guttenberg, Greenwich Village and Lincoln Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
